methods.name: setSelection
methods.description:
Selects the text in range (start, end). If start equals end, no text will be selected, and the cursor will move to the start position. End is not inclusive, meaning setSelection(0,0) will not select the first character, but will move the cursor to the position before the first character.

On iOS, soft keyboard would show when text is selected.

parameters.name: start
parameters.summary: Start index for selection. Value ranges from 0 to the text's length.

parameters.name: end
parameters.summary: End index for selection, not inclusive. Value ranges from 0 to the text's length.

properties.name: appearance
properties.summary: Determines the appearance of the keyboard displayed when this text area is focused.

properties.name: attributedHintText
properties.summary: Hint text attributed string.
properties.description:
The attributed hint text by the text area. If set, avoid setting common attributes in text area, such as hintText, color and font, as unexpected behaviors may result.

This has no effect when used with hintType Ti.UI.HINT_TYPE_ANIMATED.

Prior to Release 3.6.0, assign this property an object from the Titanium.UI.iOS.AttributedString class.

Since Appcelerator CLI 4.1.0 (Alloy 1.7.0), for Alloy, you can use an <AttributedHintText> element inside a <TextField> element and set the text property as node text:

<Alloy>
  <Window>
      <TextField>
        <AttributedHintText>
            Alloy is great!
        </AttributedHintText>
      </TextField>
  </Window>
</Alloy>

Then set attributes in the TSS file:

"AttributedString" : {
  attributes: [
    {
      type: Ti.UI.ATTRIBUTE_FOREGROUND_COLOR,
      value: 'red',
      range: [0, 5]
    },
    {
      type: Ti.UI.ATTRIBUTE_UNDERLINES_STYLE,
      value: Ti.UI.ATTRIBUTE_UNDERLINE_STYLE_SINGLE,
      range: [9, 5]
    }
  ]
}

properties.name: attributedString
properties.summary: TextArea attributed string.
properties.description:
The underlying attributed string drawn by the textArea. If set, avoid setting common attributes in textArea, such as value, color and font, as unexpected behaviors may result.

Prior to Release 3.6.0, assign this property an object from the Titanium.UI.iOS.AttributedString class.

Since Appcelerator CLI 4.1.0 (Alloy 1.7.0), for Alloy, you can use an <AttributedString> element inside a <TextArea> element and set the text property as node text:

<Alloy>
  <Window>
      <TextArea>
        <AttributedString>
            Alloy is great!
        </AttributedString>
      </TextArea>
  </Window>
</Alloy>

Then set attributes in the TSS file:

"AttributedString" : {
  attributes: [
    {
      type: Ti.UI.ATTRIBUTE_FOREGROUND_COLOR,
      value: 'red',
      range: [0, 5]
    },
    {
      type: Ti.UI.ATTRIBUTE_UNDERLINES_STYLE,
      value: Ti.UI.ATTRIBUTE_UNDERLINE_STYLE_SINGLE,
      range: [9, 5]
    }
  ]
}

properties.name: autocapitalization
properties.summary: Determines how text is capitalized during typing.

properties.name: autocorrect
properties.summary: Determines whether to automatically correct text entered into this text area.
properties.description:
Set to true to enable automatic spelling correction. On iOS 9+, this can be used to disable QuickType suggestions.

If this property is not explicitly defined, it behaves as though it were set to true.

On Android and iOS, the returned default value is undefined, but behave as if the value is true.

properties.name: autofillType
properties.summary: Sets the autofill type for the text area.
properties.description: This sets the hint or content type to aid the autofill feature of iOS and Android to function.

properties.name: autoLink
properties.summary: Automatically convert text to clickable links.
properties.description:
iOS supports an additional autolink type, AUTOLINK_CALENDAR.

Multiple autolink values can be combined with a bitwise OR. For example:

textArea.autoLink = Ti.UI.AUTOLINK_MAP_ADDRESSES|Ti.UI.AUTOLINK_PHONE_NUMBERS;

Prior to Release 3.0, this field used platform-specific constants. These are now deprecated in favor of the AUTOLINK constants.

On Android, the LINKIFY legacy constants are defined in Titanium.UI.Android.

On iOS, the AUTODETECT legacy constants are defined in Titanium.UI.iOS.

properties.name: clearOnEdit
properties.summary: Determines whether the value of this text area should be cleared when it is focused.

properties.name: color
properties.summary: Color of the text in this text area, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: editable
properties.summary: Determines whether this field can be edited.

properties.name: ellipsize
properties.summary: Determines whether an ellipsis (...) should be used to indicate truncated text.

properties.name: enableReturnKey
properties.summary: Determines whether the return key is enabled automatically when there is text in this text area.
properties.description: If true, the return key is disabled when this text area is empty, and automatically enabled as soon as the user types any text in the area.

properties.name: font
properties.summary: Font to use for text.

properties.name: fullscreen
properties.summary: Leave some space above the keyboard in landscape mode or not.
properties.description: Switch between a fullscreen keyboard in landscape mode (default) or a non-fullscreen keyboard which will leave some space to display UI elements.

properties.name: handleLinks
properties.summary: Specifies if the text area should allow user interaction with the given URL in the given range of text.
properties.description: When the text is specified using an attributed string and the text has an attribute of type ATTRIBUTE_LINK, this property controls if the system should handle that link automatically.

properties.name: hintText
properties.summary: Hint text to display when the field is empty.
properties.description:
Hint text is hidden when the user enters text into this text area.

Use the backslash and letter n line feed character combination, ie \n, to force a new line.

Use unicode characters, such as those included in (but not limited to) the Unicode List of Useful Symbols section of wikipedia, to insert special characters and symbols.

properties.name: hintTextColor
properties.summary: Color of hint text that displays when field is empty.
properties.description:
Hint text color in Android is determined by the theme of the application. By default, the theme is Theme.AppCompat which is a Dark theme. When you create the background to be white, the hint text color would also be white, hence not visible to the user. To change this, you can edit the tiapp.xml file with another theme. Example as follows:

<android xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android">
    <manifest>
        <application android:theme="@style/Theme.AppCompat.Light"/>
    </manifest>
</android>

Another way to change the hint text color is to use this property and specify a color.

This has no effect when used with hintType Ti.UI.HINT_TYPE_ANIMATED. Instead a theme must be used that defines the android:textColorHint attribute.
properties.default: Default Android theme's hint text color.

properties.name: hintType
properties.summary: Hint type to display on the text field.
properties.description: Setting this to HINT_TYPE_ANIMATED will use the animated TextInputLayout on Android.

properties.name: keyboardAppearance
properties.summary: Determines the appearance of the keyboard displayed when this text area is focused.

properties.name: keyboardToolbar
properties.summary: Array of toolbar button objects or a Titanium.UI.iOS.Toolbar to be used when the keyboard is displayed.
properties.description: As of Release 2.0, because iOS disallows a view (including toolbar buttons) to be in two places at once, developers desiring textAreas or Titanium.UI.TextField to share a toolbar can instead use a single Titanium.UI.iOS.Toolbar instead of having arrays sharing toolbar buttons.

properties.name: keyboardToolbarColor
properties.summary: Color of the keyboard toolbar if keyboardToolbar is an array, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: keyboardToolbarHeight
properties.summary: Height of the keyboard toolbar if keyboardToolbar is an array.

properties.name: keyboardType
properties.summary: Keyboard type to display when this text area is focused.
properties.description: When asking for a specific kind of user input, such as a phone number or email address, you should always specify the appropriate keyboard type.

properties.name: lines
properties.summary: Number of lines tall the text area height will be, if set.
properties.description: Sets the height of the text area by line height. Set to -1 to respect the view's height property instead.

properties.name: maxLength
properties.summary: Maximum length of text field input.
properties.description: Any attempt to input text beyond this length (including pasting a string larger than maxLength) will not edit the field's contents. A value of -1 indicates unlimited length.

properties.name: maxLines
properties.summary: Maximum line count of text field input.
properties.description: Sets the maximum of lines that the field will be extended to when pressing Return.

properties.name: padding
properties.summary: Sets the left and right padding of this TextArea. The text will always be vertically centered.

properties.name: returnKeyType
properties.summary: Specifies the text to display on the keyboard Return key when this text area is focused.

properties.name: scrollable
properties.summary: Determines whether this text area can be scrolled.

properties.name: scrollsToTop
properties.summary: Controls whether the scroll-to-top gesture is effective.
properties.description: The scroll-to-top gesture is a tap on the status bar; The default value of this property is true. This gesture works when you have a single visible text area. If there are multiple table views, web views, text areas, and/or scroll views visible, you will need to disable (set to false) on the above views you DON'T want this behaviour on. The remaining view will then respond to scroll-to-top gesture.

properties.name: selection
properties.summary: Returns the currently selected text of the text area.
properties.description:
This property is useful to track the current cursor position of the text area. On iOS this property can be used in lieu of the selected event.

This method will return null on android and undefined on iOS if the view has not yet been attached to the window.

properties.name: showUndoRedoActions
properties.summary: Determinates if the undo and redo buttons on the left side of the keyboard should be displayed or not. Only valid on iOS9 and above. This property can only be set upon creation.

properties.name: suppressReturn
properties.summary: Determines if the return key should be suppressed during text entry.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.summary:
Text alignment within this text area.

This has no effect on hintText when hintType is Ti.UI.HINT_TYPE_ANIMATED.

properties.name: value
properties.summary: Value of this text area, which may be set programmatically and modified by the user.
properties.description:
Use the backslash and letter n line feed character combination, ie \n, to force a new line.

Use unicode characters, such as those included in (but not limited to) the Unicode List of Useful Symbols section of wikipedia, to insert special characters and symbols.

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.summary: Vertical alignment within this text area.
